metadata.Title: CVE-2012-5855 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - negligible.
metadata.Description: The SHAddToRecentDocs function in VideoLAN VLC media player 2.0.4 and earlier might allow user-assisted attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via a crafted file name that triggers an incorrect string-length calculation when the file is added to VLC.  NOTE: it is not clear whether this issue crosses privilege boundaries or whether it can be exploited without user interaction.

criterions.comment: vlc: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
